metadata.title: CVE-2016-9185 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
In OpenStack Heat, by launching a new Heat stack with a local URL anauthenticated user may conduct network discovery revealing internal networkconfiguration. Affected versions are <=5.0.3, >=6.0.0 <=6.1.0, and ==7.0.0.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-9185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heat-api - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
heat-api-cfn - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
heat-api-cloudwatch - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
heat-common - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
heat-engine - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
python-heat - 1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heat package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.0.0~rc1-0ubuntu2').
